children.label: The Śra'ta & Kaskada cultures independently invent Śra'tik & Kaskadik writing
Śra'ta
children: Śra'ta loses the /ʊ/ sound, merging it into /ə/
The Śra'tik, Having much easier access to stone, write straight shapes, with angles, but no curves

children.label: Kaskada
children: The Kaskada, living in a more wooded area, develop a system that is written along the grain of a tree

children.label: Śraka'ska
children: Description : The culture that would later become Śra'ta & Kaskada

children.label: *Śraka'skik
children: Description : The reconstructed language & writing of the Śraka'ska people

children.label: Śra'tik
children: Description : The language & writing of the Śra'ta people

children.label: Kaskadik
children: Description : The language & writing of the Kaskada people
